For all other use contact the Manager of the McClung Historical Collection, 500 West Church Avenue, Knoxville, TN, 37902-2505. (865) 215-8801.

bibl.title: [Letter] 1839 Apr. 25, Mouth of Sweet Water [to] Cha[rle]s F. Welcker / A[lbert] S. Lenoir
bibl.author: Lenoir, Albert S.
bibl.note: This documents is a letter dated April 25, 1839, from Albert S. Lenoir to his brother-in-law Charles Frederick Welcker in Roane County. Lenoir encloses in the letter a table of the land recently purchased by him and Charles' brother Henry.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.p: George continued better yesterday & says he is better this morning I think him in a fair way to get well.

As to Ham & family my situation is such that it would not suit me at all to take them for so short a time as next Christmas_ I should have to build them a house & build a blacksmith shop & procure tools iron &c, all of which I fear would take me till near Christmas & it is probable I have iron a plenty in the fire now.
I can only let you have a plan of Chattanooga on loan, as it be longs to brother Thos.

You will see from the list that Henry & myself got but little besides the scraps. We agreed to be equally interested in all that we had purchased._ I put down the list as it was made.
Market Street No. 64 A. S. Lenoir$300.
Cherry Do" 4Do55
Chestnut " South half18Do150
" " North "22Do100
" " South "24"250
" " North "30H. I. Welcker105
Walnut Street26I. S. Lenoir250
" "28Do305
" "30Dr. Farmer330
High "27Dr Lyde305
Poplar "234 21A.S.L75
" " 574 59Do120
" "55__Do130
Cypress StreetNo 53A.S.L$20
" "" 51Do35
" "" 49Do35
" "" 45 & 47Do45
" "" 43 & 41Do20
" "" 38, 36 & 34Do100 The lotts on Market street sold at from about 3 to 16 hundred dollars, in other parts of the town, somewhat in proportion to the prices given.
De Witt is nearly ready to start & I must stop.
